de.Lathanael.BinaryFileDB.API
Class DBAccessLocked

java.lang.Object
  de.Lathanael.BinaryFileDB.API.DBAccessLocked

public class DBAccessLocked
extends java.lang.Object

This class provides an API to a BinaryFile-DataBase through
the use of a RecordsFile.
It also provides some methods to handle multiple files of the
same type and a WriteQueue to lesser the I/O done by the
file-database and a ReentrantReadWriteLock.

Author:
Lathanael (aka Philippe Leipold)

Constructor Detail

DBAccessLocked

public DBAccessLocked(java.lang.String dbPath,
                      int initialSize)
               throws java.io.IOException,
                      RecordsFileException,
                      CacheSizeException
Creates a new database file. The initialSize parameter determines the
amount of space which is allocated for the index. The index can grow
dynamically, but the parameter is provided to increase efficiency.
The queue function is disabled.

Parameters:
dbPath - - Pathname where the file is located as a String
initialSize - - Size of the db created
Throws:
CacheSizeException
java.io.IOException
RecordsFileException

DBAccessLocked

public DBAccessLocked(java.lang.String dbPath,
                      java.lang.String accessFlags)
               throws java.io.IOException,
                      RecordsFileException,
                      CacheSizeException
Opens an existing database and initializes the in-memory index.
The queue function is disabled.

Parameters:
dbPath - - Pathname where the file is located as a String
accessFlags - - Whether the new DBFile should hava read-only "r" or read/write "rw" access
Throws:
CacheSizeException
java.io.IOException
RecordsFileException

DBAccessLocked

public DBAccessLocked(java.lang.String path,
                      int initialSize,
                      boolean useQueue,
                      int queueSize)
               throws java.io.IOException,
                      RecordsFileException,
                      CacheSizeException
Creates a new database file. The initialSize parameter determines the
amount of space which is allocated for the index. The index can grow
dynamically, but the parameter is provided to increase efficiency.

Parameters:
path - - Pathname where the file is located as a String
initialSize - - Size of the db created
useQueue - - If set to true a queue will be created to lessen IO stress on the Disk
queueSize - - Size of the queue if it is used it must be greater 0!
Throws:
CacheSizeException
java.io.IOException
RecordsFileException

useQueue - - If set to true a queue will be created to lessen IO stress on the Disk
queueSize - - Size of the queue if it is used it must be greater 0!

DBAccessLocked

public DBAccessLocked(java.lang.String dbPath,
                      int initialSize,
                      int MAX_KEY_LENGTH,
                      int DATA_START_HEADER_LOCATION,
                      int FILE_HEADERS_REGION_LENGTH,
                      int RECORD_HEADER_LENGTH)
               throws java.io.IOException,
                      RecordsFileException,
                      CacheSizeException
Creates a new database file. The initialSize parameter determines the
amount of space which is allocated for the index. The index can grow
dynamically, but the parameter is provided to increase
efficiency. Let's the user define the length of keys etc.
The queue function is disabled.

Parameters:
dbPath - - Pathname where the file is located as a String
initialSize - - Size of the db created
MAX_KEY_LENGTH - - MAX_KEY_LENGTH
DATA_START_HEADER_LOCATION - - DATA_START_HEADER_LOCATION
FILE_HEADERS_REGION_LENGTH - - FILE_HEADERS_REGION_LENGTH
RECORD_HEADER_LENGTH - RECORD_HEADER_LENGTH
Throws:
CacheSizeException

DBAccessLocked

public DBAccessLocked(java.lang.String dbPath,
                      int initialSize,
                      int cacheSize)
               throws java.io.IOException,
                      RecordsFileException,
                      CacheSizeException
Creates a new database file. The initialSize parameter determines the
amount of space which is allocated for the index. The index can grow
dynamically, but the parameter is provided to increase efficiency.
The queue function is disabled.

Parameters:
dbPath - - Pathname where the file is located as a String
initialSize - - Size of the db created
cacheSize - - Size of the initial cache for recently loaded RecordReaders. Must be greater 0!
Throws:
CacheSizeException
java.io.IOException
RecordsFileException

getRecord

public RecordReader getRecord(java.lang.String key)
                       throws RecordsFileException,
                              java.io.IOException,
                              java.lang.InterruptedException
Gets a record as a RecordReader object from the DB.

If the WriteQueue is activated it will first check if the entry is scheduled and get the changed Record.

Parameters:
key -
Returns:
RecordReader object associated to the key or null
Throws:
RecordsFileException
java.io.IOException
java.lang.InterruptedException

writeRecord

public void writeRecord(RecordWriter rw)
                 throws RecordsFileException,
                        java.io.IOException,
                        QueueException,
                        java.lang.InterruptedException
Writes a Record to the DB. Existing ones will be updated.

If the queue is activated it will try to add the RecordWriter to it.
If it fails it will write the whole queue to the DB, clear it and finally
add the given RecordWriter to the now empty queue.

Parameters:
rw - - RecordWriter object which should be written
Throws:
RecordsFileException
java.io.IOException
QueueException
java.lang.InterruptedException

appendRecord

public void appendRecord(RecordWriter rw)
                  throws RecordsFileException,
                         java.io.IOException,
                         QueueException,
                         java.lang.InterruptedException
Writes a Record to the DB without searching for free-space. Existing ones will be updated.

If the queue is activated it will try to add the RecordWriter to it.
If it fails it will write the whole queue to the DB, clear it and finally
add the given RecordWriter to the now empty queue.

Parameters:
rw - - RecordWriter object which should be written
Throws:
java.io.IOException
RecordsFileException
QueueException
java.lang.InterruptedException

quickWriteRecord

public void quickWriteRecord(RecordWriter rw)
                      throws RecordsFileException,
                             java.io.IOException,
                             java.lang.InterruptedException
Writes a Record to the DB ignoring the queue. Existing ones will be updated.

Parameters:
rw - - RecordWriter object which should be written
Throws:
RecordsFileException
java.io.IOException
java.lang.InterruptedException

quickInsertRecord

public void quickInsertRecord(RecordWriter rw)
                       throws RecordsFileException,
                              java.io.IOException,
                              java.lang.InterruptedException
Writes a Record to the DB without searching for free-space and ignoring the queue.
Existing ones will be updated.

Parameters:
rw - - RecordWriter object which should be written
Throws:
RecordsFileException
java.io.IOException
java.lang.InterruptedException

deleteRecord

public void deleteRecord(java.lang.String key)
                  throws RecordsFileException,
                         java.io.IOException,
                         java.lang.InterruptedException
Deletes the Record associated with the key. This will also remove the record
from the queue if it is activated and the record is in it.

Parameters:
key - - The key as a String to indicate which Record should be deleted
Throws:
RecordsFileException
java.io.IOException
java.lang.InterruptedException

closeDB

public void closeDB(boolean unsafe)
             throws java.io.IOException,
                    RecordsFileException,
                    java.lang.InterruptedException
Closes this instance of the DataBase.

Parameters:
unsafe - - If true the file will be closed without saving pending records
Throws:
java.io.IOException
RecordsFileException
java.lang.InterruptedException
